Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2007 01:01AM suzyb855 wrote: My Chemo will start Oct. 2.  I am stage IIB, triple negative.  I had a modified radical mastectomy of my left breast on 8/20.  I don't know what to expect with chemo.  I guess I'll figure it our real soon!  I had so many plans for the fall and everything is on hold till I get this behind me!  I can't wait to hop off this rollercoaster!
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2007 08:57AM suzyb855 wrote: Hi Roach 59 Thanks for the info  Believe it or not the surgery was not so bad.  I only stayed in the hospital one night.  I was thankful for that because my kids were pretty freaked out with the hospital.  We were all more comfortable at home. The worse part of the whole thing were the drain tubes they put under my arm.  They were so uncomfortable.  They didn't really hurt, just a pain in the butt!  I was thankful to have them removed last week. Having a small pillow to put under my arm really helped me to feel more comfortable.  My surgery was 4 weeks ago and I am feeling great.  I am excited to head off to work  today just to get out of the house and have something to do! I'm glad to hear your chemo was not so horrible.  I hope I have the same experience.
